summary: Starter, plug-and-play cultural dataset for Varanasi (2+ entries per category)

festivals.name: Ganga Aarti (Dashashwamedh Ghat)
festivals.short_description: A synchronized evening ritual of lamps and hymns performed on the ghats for the River Ganga.
festivals.notes: Performed daily on Dashashwamedh Ghat and major ghats; major spectacle during festivals.

festivals.name: Durga Puja
festivals.short_description: Major festival celebrated with idols and pandals.
festivals.notes: Famous across India, but also celebrated in Varanasi.

festivals.name: Dev Deepawali
festivals.short_description: Festival of lights celebrated fifteen days after Diwali, with thousands of diyas lit on the ghats of Varanasi.
festivals.notes: Unique to Varanasi; attracts lakhs of pilgrims and tourists.

festivals.name: Mahashivratri
festivals.short_description: Night dedicated to Lord Shiva, celebrated with special rituals at Kashi Vishwanath Temple.
festivals.notes: Kashi is one of the holiest places to observe Mahashivratri.

monuments.name: Kashi Vishwanath Temple
monuments.short_description: One of the holiest Shiva temples in India and one of the twelve Jyotirlingas.
monuments.notes: Historic temple; recent Kashi corridor project improved access.

monuments.name: Ramnagar Fort
monuments.short_description: 18th-century fort and museum on the eastern bank of the Ganges; hosts the traditional Ramlila.
monuments.notes: Historic seat of the erstwhile Kashi royal family.

monuments.name: Sarnath
monuments.short_description: Buddhist pilgrimage site where Lord Buddha delivered his first sermon after enlightenment.
monuments.notes: Famous for Dhamek Stupa and Ashokan Pillar; 10 km from Varanasi city.

monuments.name: Sankat Mochan Hanuman Temple
monuments.short_description: One of the most visited temples in Varanasi, dedicated to Lord Hanuman.
monuments.notes: Established by Tulsidas; famous for Tuesday/Saturday crowds and annual music festival.

monuments.name: Bharat Mata Mandir
monuments.short_description: Temple housing a marble relief map of undivided India instead of a deity idol.
monuments.notes: Inaugurated by Mahatma Gandhi in 1936; unique nationalist shrine.

food.name: Kachori Sabzi
food.short_description: Spicy kachoris served with potato curry, a popular breakfast in Varanasi.
food.notes: Best enjoyed at local street stalls in the morning.

food.name: Malaiyyo
food.short_description: Delicate saffron-flavored frothy milk dessert available only in winters.
food.notes: Also called 'Nimish'; served in kulhads early morning.

food.name: Lassi
food.short_description: Thick yogurt-based drink served in earthen pots, often topped with rabri.
food.notes: Famous in Godowlia area of Varanasi.

food.name: Banarasi Paan
food.short_description: Sweet and savoury betel-leaf preparations unique to Banaras; cultural culinary tradition.
food.notes: Paan is an iconic culinary finish in Varanasi and has local processing methods.

crafts.name: Banarasi Saree
crafts.short_description: Handwoven silk sarees with gold and silver brocade, globally renowned.
crafts.notes: Essential attire for Indian weddings; GI-tagged craft.

crafts.name: Wooden Toys
crafts.short_description: Colorful hand-carved and painted wooden toys made by artisans.
crafts.notes: Traditional craft of Varanasi, especially popular among children.

crafts.name: Gulabi Meenakari
crafts.short_description: Rare Persian art of pink enamel work practiced only in Varanasi.
crafts.notes: Used in jewelry and decorative pieces; only a few families keep it alive.

crafts.name: Brass & Metalware
crafts.short_description: Traditional brass lamps, utensils and decorative metalwork made in and around Varanasi.
crafts.notes: Often sold near ghats and markets; used in daily rituals and ceremonies.

stories.title: Legend of Shiva and the Ganga
stories.text: Kashi (Varanasi) is traditionally associated with Lord Shiva; the sacred Ganga flowing through the city is central to many myths where Shiva grants the river descent to Earth.
stories.notes: Short, retellable folktale for app storyteller mode.

stories.title: Ramlila at Ramnagar
stories.text: A centuries-old open-air Ramlila performance hosted in and around Ramnagar Fort, with traditional staging and community involvement.
stories.notes: Rich theatrical tradition and community event.

stories.title: Legend of Manikarnika Ghat
stories.text: According to mythology, Goddess Parvati’s earring (Manikarnika) fell here, making the ghat sacred for cremation rituals.

stories.title: Story of Ganga’s Descent
stories.text: It is believed that when the River Ganga descended from the heavens, Lord Shiva caught her in his locks at Kashi to soften her flow.

stories.title: Tale of Raja Harishchandra
stories.text: The legendary king Harishchandra worked at the cremation ground of Harishchandra Ghat as part of his devotion to truth and duty.

ghats.name: Dashashwamedh Ghat
ghats.short_description: One of Varanasi’s oldest and most famous ghats, renowned for the evening Ganga Aarti.
ghats.address: Dashashwamedh Ghat, near Kashi Vishwanath, Varanasi
ghats.notes: Main aarti ghat and a major tourist attraction.

ghats.name: Manikarnika Ghat
ghats.short_description: Ancient ghat historically used for cremation; considered highly sacred.
ghats.notes: One of the primary cremation ghats in Kashi with deep religious significance.

ghats.name: Assi Ghat
ghats.short_description: The southernmost popular ghat known for morning bhajans, Subah-e-Banaras sessions and student hangouts.
ghats.address: Assi Ghat, Nagwa Road, Shivala, Varanasi 221005
ghats.notes: Popular with youth and tourists; boat rides are common from here.

ghats.name: Harishchandra Ghat
ghats.short_description: Historic ghat associated with last rites and the legendary King Harishchandra.
ghats.address: Harishchandra Ghat, near Lahori Tola, Varanasi
ghats.notes: Linked to the legend of Raja Harishchandra; still used for cremation rituals.

ghats.name: Panchganga Ghat
ghats.short_description: Sacred ghat where five streams/rivers are believed to meet — a ritual spot for pilgrims.
ghats.notes: Highly sacred spot; good for sunrise views and small pilgrim ceremonies.
